author: Devesh K
text:
The Enforcement Directorate has initiated a preliminary inquiry into the dealings of the Noida-based firm Ringing Bells, which triggered a controversy after it recently launched the world’s cheapest smartphone for just Rs. 251. The company has already booked orders for about 7 crore mobile sets.

The ED has contacted the promoters of Ringing Bells seeking answers to the revenue model adopted by the company.

The agency will ascertain whether the firm has in any way violated rules under the Foreign Exchange Management Act.

Soon after the company announced the offer, the Indian Cellular Association had written to the Union Minister for Communications and Information Technology, Ravi Shankar Prasad, raising questions on the pricing of the smartphone. Taking cognisance, the Department of Electronics and IT held a meeting with the company representatives, during which the firm explained its business model.
title: ED begins probe into Ringing Bells’ revenue model
